name: RenderContainer
description: A function that takes a renderer and does the custom rendering logic. This is the function that will be called each frame. ```js import { RenderContainer } from 'pixi.js'; // create a new render container const renderContainer = new RenderContainer((renderer) => { // custom render logic here renderer.clear({ clearColor: 'green', // clear the screen to green when rendering this item }); }); ``` / export type RenderFunction = (renderer: Renderer) => void; /** Options for the {@link RenderContainer} constructor. / export interface RenderContainerOptions extends ContainerOptions { /** the optional custom render function if you want to inject the function via the constructor */ render?: RenderFunction; /** how to know if the custom render logic contains a point or not, used for interaction */ containsPoint?: (point: Point) => boolean; /** how to add the bounds of this object when measuring */ addBounds?: (bounds: BoundsData) => void; } /** A container that allows for custom rendering logic. Its essentially calls the render function each frame and allows for custom rendering logic - the render could be a WebGL renderer or WebGPU render or even a canvas render. Its up to you to define the logic. This can be used in two ways, either by extending the class and overriding the render method, or by passing a custom render function ```js import { RenderContainer } from 'pixi.js'; // extend the class class MyRenderContainer extends RenderContainer { render(renderer) { renderer.clear({ clearColor: 'green', // clear the screen to green when rendering this item }); } } // override the render method const renderContainer = new RenderContainer( (renderer) =>  { renderer.clear({ clearColor: 'green', // clear the screen to green when rendering this item }); }) ```
